entries.femaleVariant: Hey.
First met here. Same exact court.
Just like old times, huh?
Sure we did the right thing?
[Stand and pass ball] Bye, Reed.
Different ball game.
How's Song holding up?
I wasn't sure you'd show.
Our first meet. Now you want to say goodbye?
So, what'll you do now? Plans. schemes, what?
Washington beckons. Likely for a stern audience with her majesty, then relegation to a desk at Langley.
Myers must be livid…
Even if she is, she hides it well, behind a toothy smile.
And So Mi? Any idea? Gonna get some funeral at least?
So Mi's been dead for years, officially. There's a grave in Calvary, New York, with her name on it.
I called you 'cause I never got the chance to thank you.
Cut the crap. Want the truth. Rosalind send you?
Cut the crap. Myers send you?
You sure we did the right thing?
Hope she'll be OK. Promised her that.
Return to duty how? As Myers' Blackwall puppet?
Gotta hope these "alternate means" o' yours do the trick. We made her a promise, told her she'd be OK.
Actually, maybe we should've let her die.
Got that right. We made the right choice.
What if... Reed, what if the best option was to let her die?
So, your next move?
Gotta go. See ya, Sol.
Grab a seat.
How's the game?
Trust me, thinkin'll get you nowhere. That and sleepless nights.
How's So Mi?
So what about So Mi? How's she doin'?
We had to resort to alternate means, but... So Mi will live.
The changes in her nervous system, entropic breakdown – they were too far gone. The matrix didn't take. It's now in storage. Bein' kept for you.
OK, well, see you around, Sol.
I said she'd get the best care available. A chance to make up for her mistakes, mend her ways. I can't do any more than that.
You know, I envy your ease. The ability to second-guess everything you've done. Your habit of doing so.
Try it sometime. Might discover somethin' wonderful about it.
I spent seven years on what-ifs and coulda-shoulda-wouldas. I think that's enough.
We're of different worlds, V. Different worlds with different rules. Mine allows for no mistakes.
All right, well, better get goin'.
So, sleepin' like a baby these days, are ya?
So, sleepin' like a babe these days, are ya?
I have no trouble sleeping. That's what whiskey's for.
Dreams – they're a problem at times. But I'm not about to bore you with details.
So Song had it right all along... Myers'll never let her walk free, will she? Lose her only point of access to the Blackwall...
What's important to me is that she's alive.
Why? For what price or purpose? If you can't reverse the erosion of her psyche, if she can't go back to bein' her old self, then…
We helped her is what. As long as she's alive, there's hope.
Eh, I know, you're right.  Did what we had to. Only thing we could do to give So Mi a second chance, somehow keep her safe.
I'm with you on that.
Just can't help wonderin' if… you could'nt've done more for her.
V, Songbird is an FIA agent in critical condition in an FIA clinic – in the care of our top specialists.
There's nothin' more I can do for her. It's fully outta my hands.
Whaddaya mean?
Good luck, Reed. Gotta go.
Meaning what?
So, next move in this lame game you're playin'?
Myers has summoned me back to Washington. Langley or Glynco's probably my next posting.
Desk job?
To start. For a while. Pluckin' promising operatives outta a pool of new recruits.
You know how to read people.
So you're getting deported. You're cool with that?
OK then... Good luck.
Promising operatives, you say... I gotta admit, you are pretty good at readin' people.
entries.maleVariant: Promising operatives, you say... I gotta admit, you're pretty good at readin' people.

entries.femaleVariant: I mostly have an eye for talent. But I guess that'll have to do.
Sorry to be blunt, but... were a sleeper all that time. Now you're lettin' 'em sideline you... again?
entries.maleVariant: Sorry to be blunt, but... were a sleeper all that time. Now you're lettin' 'em sideline you again?

entries.femaleVariant: You're not OK with this, that's clear.
Those're my orders. I plan to follow them. We'll see if it brings any change.
I'd rather not hash it out. It won't end well.
Only thing I can fuckin' think about.
Maybe you'll finally figure out your place on Earth.
You're stuck. Maybe for good.
Well, seems you mighta finally found your place on Earth.
Sol, you hearin' yourself?
You oughta find yours, too, before it's too late. Just not at any price – you know how that ends.
You're in a rut, stuck. Full circle again. How much crap'll you agree to eat this time?
As much as it takes.
Fuck's sake... Fine, do what you want. But if you need me again, don't wait seven years to come callin'.
'Cause I just don't got anywhere near that much time left.
Gotta get going.
How's the game'? Brings back memories.
Just no iron 'tween the ribs this time, please.
I already decided I won't kill you.
Aww, so sweet…
How's Songbird doin'?
What about helpin' me?
Wants you to learn if I've spilled to anyone already?
If Myers had even an ounce of doubt about you in her gut, you'd be dead.
You're just another Night City contact to her. Though clearly a useful one.
Me – I just wanted to talk. One last time.
You in trouble?
You in some kinda trouble?
Can't deny that.
Grab a seat. We need to talk.
Weird of you to reach out.
You failed as an FIA-associated operative. You failed me, Alex, Myers. Hell, maybe even yourself.
Woah, no holds barred, huh? Reed, I...
In spite of that, here we are, watchin' a ball game. Talkin'. Do you know why?
First met right on this court.
That why we're here? To say goodbye?
We'll see. Goodbyes come in all shapes 'n' sizes, hues and tones.
Need my help again?
Gonna help me after all?
This some sort of interrogation?
'Cause you need my help again?
Don't kid yourself. The FIA has you tagged as a "compromised asset."
If Myers' people ever knock on your door again, either run or start shooting.
So what's this about?
You were right.
Say it ain't so, Sol. You here to apologize? Tell me you'll help after all?
I see you still have your sense of humor.
I can't help you, and I got nothin' to apologize for. Close, though.
All right, lemme hear it.
Convo's started soundin' like an interrogation, Sol.
Is that so? With no handcuffs, no black bag over your head?
Sure, forget it. Spill.
If this was an interrogation, you'd know.
I wanted to tell you in person. You were right, V.
Thanks. So you changed your mind.
That I didn't expect.
Thanks. What changed your mind?
Shit, wasn't expectin' that.
I'm not surprised.
V, I almost lost everything 'cause of you.
Fuck, Reed...
Don't talk, just listen.
I lost partners, friends. The trust of my superiors.
Everything I believed in, built my life on… gone in seconds.
Know what it's like to have your life fall apart.
Know how it feels to have your world flip upside down.
Also know that a flip like that makes change easier. Think you needed it, Reed.
That's why I said I think you were right.
I got nothin' to lose now. I might be able to gain something for once, though.
All because of you. Or thanks to you. Not sure which is more fitting.
So what now?
Any idea what happened to So Mi's body?
Is Myers pissed?
She has direct lines to Night City's biggest players. Hansen's dead, and shit's about to go down in Dogtown…
She's already convinced Congress the mess in Night City was targeted, controlled and, ultimately, a resounding success.
They'll award her a second Purple Heart. She'll accept, in a teary-eyed speech in which she's sure to remind everyone that Kennedy only got one.
And that's why I hate politics.
In any case, they'll never put former FIA agent Songbird in the ground.
Groom Lake, it's a facility. They're extracting all they can. But it's all the same to her now.
Huh, Myers only pretended she'd take care...?
No, she did, she is. Just in her own way, only way she knows how.
We actually went there once. Song, Alex and me. We laid flowers, dripped some whiskey on the grave. No need to imagine her, she was right there.
I'm sorry.
Maybe scribbling on whiteboards, flipping through slides, feeding fresh recruits horseshit. Among other humiliations.
They already booked me the redeye – NC to DC direct.
You'll make a good mentor.
Who'm I to say?
Plan to get on it?
Good question. Should I?
Nah. Fuck 'em.
Yeah, you should. Just remember our talks. And remember So Mi.
I failed her as a mentor. Maybe even as a friend.
S why you won't make the same mistakes again. You'll be a preem teacher.
You're tryin' to flatter your way into a gig at Langley. Just so we're clear – over my dead body.
Please, I'm a shit agent. Way too many secrets, shifting loyalties, just nah.
Stay put. Fuck Myers, fuck the FIA. That life put you through the wringer. Time for a change.
What, go the way of Morgan Blackhand?
Why not? Afterlife'd welcome you with open arms. But it's not your only option, you know that.
Mhm, yeah.
Who'm I to say? I mean, here I am. Look to you like someone who's succeeded at simplifying their life?
You do not.
There's your answer. Don't be like me. Or be like me. Up to you.
I don't know what I'll do. And I'm all right with that.
Forgot how that felt, but I really fucking missed it. So… thanks.
Don't sweat it. Buy me a Broseph sometime.
I'm afraid there won't be a next time. You know that.
Guess you'd better.
See you soon?
OK, well, good luck, then.
entries.maleVariant: Huh. OK, well, good luck, then.

entries.femaleVariant: Interesting. Of all people, I thought you'd have more to say about this particular subject.
Know you, Sol. Know you wouldn't fuckin' listen anyway.
Hm. Got it...
Don't recruit 'em like you did So Mi.
Mhm. Like how you plucked So Mi?
I helped her.
You waited till a millisec before she flatlined and had her brain ooze out her nose. So she'd feel she owed you.
Change your MO, Reed. Or you're gonna live out some rhymin' story.
I know how to do my job, V. Still, thanks for the advice.
Thank me with a beer next time.
Was curious why you reached out. Back at the border, thought that was the last I was seein' of you.
I thought so too. Just got a few things weighing on me that I can't shake.
V, I'm gonna come out and say it.
Sounds menacing. Should I be worried?
Grave look on your face isn't reassurin'. Snipers perched somewhere? FIA pickin' off witnesses?
Do you really think I'd need support if I wanted to get rid of you? I hate to break it to you, but you're no Morgan Blackhand.
Right about what?
Need you to be more specific. What, exactly, was I right about?
entries.maleVariant: Need to be more specific. What, exactly, was I right about?

entries.femaleVariant: But I did save So Mi.
All because I believed you'd help me save So Mi.
Reed, I saved So Mi. You know that. You were angry for some other reason. Maybe still are.
Things slipped from your grip, you didn't get to make the final call.
But ya know what? From where I'm sittin', that was for the best.
entries.maleVariant: But know what? From where I'm sittin', that was for the best.

entries.femaleVariant: Don't sound like you're admitting I was right.
Why do I get the feelin' you still blame me for everything?
Because I do. But given what happened, V... well, I'm startin' to see the other side of all this shit.
We did what we had to. So Mi'll live. Good work.
Listen, help you promised me? Is everything ready?
And the help you promised – what about that?
That all you care about?
Preparations are underway. As promised.
All I wanted to hear. Be in touch.
How's So Mi feelin'?
I'll drop you a signal once our neurosurgeons're set.
Yo, ball!
See ya, Reed.
Run, escape, start over.
Sounds like a punishment.
Screw Washington. Your old life's there – that's what awaits you. Clearly need a new life. Hop in a car and full speed ahead, I say.
Langley? Shit. Sounds like more punishment. Seven years' sleep wasn't enough? Gonna let 'em keep sweepin' shit under the rug?
Maybe time for a change?
But you hate this gig.
You'll plain rot behind that desk.
Man, you hate this gig. But your head's so far up Washington's ass that you don't see it.
And then what?
Make it up as you go along. Done it, it works, I know.
That you do.
Got a few nomad friends, you could ride with them. Always a place to start. Just lemme know.
Not for you to worry about. I'll be fine.
What if you tossed 'em your ID? Cut away from all of it for good? Shit, I mean, just get in your car and slam the CHOOH2.
I'm going back to Washington. Have a few things to wrap up. But thanks all the same for the advice.
Nah, don't need to be any sort of specialist to see you're in deep, deep denial.
Rosalind used you seven years ago, used you again now. Gonna sit on your hands till she plucks you outta the freezer again?
That's the job.
Fuck, Reed. Should go corporate. Not really any safer, but the pay's sure as shit better. Least you'd have a career to show for it.
That's the job – it's thankless. The very nature of it.
Still makin' excuses for 'em, huh?
Them? Maybe. Not for myself, not anymore.
What's the plan, then?
Mhm. What else is wrong with me? Stockholm syndrome?
Few days down the road, your head'll clear. A few months more – you'll see a whole new life open up for you.
Take care, Reed.
Mhm, all right. Take care, Reed.
Good luck. You'll need it.
Well, best of luck, Reed. Could use some, you know.
Take care, V. I'm 'onna hang back a little.
Then what've we done, Reed?
I believe she might even return to active duty.
You're right...
Time you stopped lyin' to yourself.
Can't, huh? Or maybe you can't admit you been lyin' to yourself from the start?
Got no response, do you?
I don't, no. 'Cause that would lift all your doubts, wouldn't it? Trust me, that kind of answer just don't exist.
